plausibledeniability.create_password_explanation: Password for fake storage should not match the password for your main storage.
plausibledeniability.help: Under certain circumstances, you might be forced to disclose a password. To keep your coins safe, BlueWallet can create another encrypted storage with a different password. Under pressure, you can disclose this password to a 3rd party. If entered in BlueWallet, it will unlock a new “fake” storage. This will seem legit to the third party, but it will secretly keep your main storage with coins safe.
plausibledeniability.help2: The new storage will be fully functional, and you can store some minimum amounts there so it looks more believable.
plausibledeniability.password_should_not_match: Password is currently in use. Please try a different password.
plausibledeniability.passwords_do_not_match: Passwords do not match. Please try again.
plausibledeniability.title: Plausible Deniability

pleasebackup.ask: Have you saved your wallet's backup phrase? This backup phrase is required to access your funds in case you lose this device. Without the backup phrase, your funds will be permanently lost.
pleasebackup.text: Please take a moment to write down this mnemonic phrase on a piece of paper. It's your backup you can use to restore the wallet on other device.
pleasebackup.text_lnd: Please take a moment to save this LNDHub authentication. It's your backup you can use to restore the wallet on other device.
pleasebackup.title: Your wallet is created.

settings.about_free: BlueWallet is a free and open-source project. Crafted by Bitcoin users.
settings.biom_10times: You have attempted to enter your password 10 times. Would you like to reset your storage? This will remove all wallets and decrypt your storage.
settings.biom_no_passcode: Your device does not have a passcode. In order to proceed, please configure a passcode in the Settings app.
settings.biom_remove_decrypt: All your wallets will be removed and your storage will be decrypted. Are you sure you want to proceed?
settings.default_desc: When disabled, BlueWallet will immediately open the selected wallet at launch.
settings.electrum_error_connect: Can't connect to provided Electrum server
settings.electrum_saved: Your changes have been saved successfully. Restart may be required for changes to take effect.
settings.electrum_settings_explain: Set to blank to use default
settings.electrum_clear_alert_message: Do you want to clear electrum servers history?
settings.encrypt_decrypt_q: Are you sure you want to decrypt your storage? This will allow your wallets to be accessed without a password.
settings.encrypt_use_expl: {type} will be used to confirm your identity prior to making a transaction, unlocking, exporting, or deleting a wallet. {type} will not be used to unlock an encrypted storage.
settings.general_adv_mode_e: When enabled, you will see advanced options such as different wallet types, the ability to specify the LNDHub instance you wish to connect to and custom entropy during wallet creation.
settings.general_continuity_e: When enabled, you will be able to view selected wallets, and transactions, using your other Apple iCloud connected devices.
settings.groundcontrol_explanation: GroundControl is a free opensource push notifications server for Bitcoin wallets. You can install your own GroundControl server and put its URL here to not rely on BlueWallet's infrastructure. Leave blank to use default
settings.language_restart: When selecting a new language, restarting BlueWallet may be required for the change to take effect.
settings.lightning_saved: Your changes have been saved successfully
settings.lightning_settings_explain: To connect to your own LND node please install LNDHub and put its URL here in settings. Leave blank to use BlueWallet's LNDHub (lndhub.io). Wallets created after saving changes will connect to the specified LNDHub.
settings.password_explain: Create the password you will use to decrypt the storage
settings.privacy_read_clipboard_alert: BlueWallet will display shortcuts for handling an invoice or address found in your clipboard.
settings.privacy_quickactions_explanation: Touch and hold the BlueWallet app icon on your Home Screen to quickly view your wallet's balance.
settings.privacy_clipboard_explanation: Provide shortcuts if an address, or invoice, is found in your clipboard.
settings.success_transaction_broadcasted: Success! You transaction has been broadcasted!
settings.total_balance_explanation: Display the total balance of all your wallets on your home screen widgets.

notifications.would_you_like_to_receive_notifications: Would you like to receive notifications when you get incoming payments?

transactions.cancel_explain: We will replace this transaction with the one that pays you and has higher fees. This effectively cancels transaction. This is called RBF—Replace by Fee.
transactions.cpfp_exp: We will create another transaction that spends your unconfirmed transaction. The total fee will be higher than the original transaction fee, so it should be mined faster. This is called CPFP - Child Pays For Parent.
transactions.transaction_note_saved: Transaction note has been successfully saved.
transactions.enable_hw: This wallet is not being used in conjunction with a hardware wallet. Would you like to enable hardware wallet use?
transactions.rbf_explain: We will replace this transaction with the one with a higher fee, so it should be mined faster. This is called RBF - Replace By Fee.

wallets.import_error: Failed to import. Please make sure that the provided data is valid.
wallets.import_explanation: Write here your mnemonic, private key, WIF, or anything you've got. BlueWallet will do its best to guess the correct format and import your wallet.
wallets.import_success: Your wallet has been successfully imported.

It's free and you can create 
as many as you like.
wallets.list_empty_txs1_lightning: Lightning wallet should be used for your daily transactions. Fees are unfairly cheap and the speed is blazing fast.
wallets.list_empty_txs2_lightning: To start using it tap on “manage funds” and topup your balance.
wallets.list_header: A wallet represents a pair of keys, one private and one you can share to receive coins.

wallets.list_import_problem: There was a problem importing this wallet

multisig.ms_help_title: How Multisig Vaults work. Tips and tricks
multisig.ms_help_text: A wallet with multiple keys, to exponentially increase security or for shared custody.
multisig.ms_help_1: The Vault will work with other BlueWallet apps and PSBT compatible wallets, like Electrum, Specter, Coldcard, Cobo vault, etc.
multisig.ms_help_2: You can create all Vault keys in this device, and remove or edit these keys later. Having all keys on the same device has the equivalent security of a regular Bitcoin wallet.
multisig.ms_help_3: On the wallet options you will find your Vault backup and watch-only backup. This backup is like a map to your wallet. It is essential for wallet recovery in case you lose one of your seeds.
multisig.ms_help_4: To import a Multisig, use your multisig backup file and use the import feature. If you only have extended keys and seeds, you can use the individual import fields on the Add Vault flow.
multisig.ms_help_5: By default BlueWallet will generate a 2of3 Vault. To create a different quorum or to change the address type, activate the advanced options in the Settings.
